intro: Racosperma declinatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds, typical of the legume family. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticulture.
